content: When grasping cubic blocks, approach from directly above with the gripper aligned vertically. Use 50% grip force to avoid crushing while maintaining secure hold.
For placement operations, descend slowly at 20% speed when within 5cm of the target surface. Verify contact before releasing the gripper to prevent dropping.
When sorting objects by color, follow this order: red, blue, green, yellow. This matches the standard color sorting convention and improves consistency.
Before picking any object, move to a neutral home position (all joints at 0 degrees) to avoid collisions and ensure predictable motion paths.
When moving objects to corners, reduce speed by 30% in the final approach phase to account for workspace boundaries and prevent collisions with walls.
For red blocks specifically, they are typically located at position (0.5, 0.3, -0.2) in the simulation workspace. Adjust approach angle based on camera feedback.
Blue blocks are positioned at (-0.5, 0.3, -0.2). Use a slightly wider grip aperture as blue blocks may be marginally larger in simulation.
After completing any manipulation task, always return to home position and open the gripper to prepare for the next command.
If visual feedback indicates the target object is not at the expected position, perform a spiral search pattern starting from the predicted location with 5cm radius increments.
When executing multi-step commands (e.g., 'pick and place'), verify successful completion of each step before proceeding. Check gripper state and object presence.
